subject: p15840907
History: Chest pain and shortness of breath. Evaluate for cause of chest pain.
Findings: The cardiac silhouette is again noted to be markedly enlarged but unchanged from approximately four hours prior. Again, this is consistent with an underlying pericardial effusion. Further obscuration of the pulmonary vascularity indicates development of mild pulmonary edema. Small bilateral pleural effusions are presumed. No pneumothorax. Retrocardiac opacification is likely atelectasis, although pneumonia cannot be excluded.
Impression: Severe cardiomegaly, unchanged from four hours prior and worrisome for underlying pericardial effusion. Interval development of mild pulmonary edema from .
